questiontext.text:
John Smith has 3 children: Antoinette, 10.2, Lawrence, 12.9, Sebastian, 9.7.
The mean age of the children is $$\mu$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=10.9:0.55}.
The eldest child is : {1:MULTICHOICE: Antoinette ~= Lawrence ~ Sebastian}.
The child with the longest name is {1:SHORTANSWER:~=Antoinette}.

John Smith has 3 children: Antoinette, 23.4, Lawrence, 12.5, Sebastian, 17.2.
The mean age of the children is $$\mu$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=17.7:0.89}.
The eldest child is : {1:MULTICHOICE:= Antoinette ~ Lawrence ~ Sebastian}.
The child with the longest name is {1:SHORTANSWER:~=Antoinette}.

John Smith has 3 children: Antoinette, 4.9, Lawrence, 14.1, Sebastian, 8.5.
The mean age of the children is $$\mu$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=9.2:0.46}.
The eldest child is : {1:MULTICHOICE: Antoinette ~= Lawrence ~ Sebastian}.
The child with the longest name is {1:SHORTANSWER:~=Antoinette}.

John Smith has 3 children: Anastasia, 10.2, Catherine, 12.9, Quentin, 9.7.
The mean age of the children is $$\mu$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=10.9:0.55}.
The eldest child is : {1:MULTICHOICE: Anastasia ~= Catherine ~ Quentin}.
The child with the longest name is {1:SHORTANSWER:~=Catherine}.

John Smith has 3 children: Anastasia, 23.4, Catherine, 12.5, Quentin, 17.2.
The mean age of the children is $$\mu$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=17.7:0.89}.
The eldest child is : {1:MULTICHOICE:= Anastasia ~ Catherine ~ Quentin}.
The child with the longest name is {1:SHORTANSWER:~=Catherine}.

John Smith has 3 children: Anastasia, 4.9, Catherine, 14.1, Quentin, 8.5.
The mean age of the children is $$\mu$$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=9.2:0.46}.
The eldest child is : {1:MULTICHOICE: Anastasia ~= Catherine ~ Quentin}.
The child with the longest name is {1:SHORTANSWER:~=Catherine}.
